sols_html:
We have

\[\begin{aligned} A - \lambda I = \left(\begin{array}{cc} 3 - \lambda & 1 \\ -4 & -1 - \lambda \end{array}\right)\end{aligned}\]

which has determinant

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle{}(3 - \lambda)(-1 - \lambda) - (-4)(1) = \lambda^2 - 2 \lambda + 1.\end{aligned}\]

Setting \(\lambda^2 - 2 \lambda + 1 = 0\) we find \(\lambda = 1\) as the only eigenvalue.
